column4: I am sharing internet (via firestarter)   to my desktop as for some  reason it can't connect to my router (too far away)
however, my laptop can.. problem is.. I'm afraid I'm going to kill my LCD in my laptop having it on all the time
but if I shut the lid.. bam. Internet disconnects
from the laptop I mean.. therefore.. no connection to even share
pisses me off because I went to power management and set everything accordingly
seems your antenna is under the lid
how about just telling it to turn the display off and not activate any screensaver?
the person on that forum said that he had  the same problem until he switched to another WiFi channel
sounds to me a simple solution would be to get a wifi card or dongle for your tower :P
perhaps they too should buy wifi cards or dongles :P
that is just the way it goes.. nothing lasts forever
heh.. just using the blank screensaver would have been much easier
laptops are typically like disposable cameras anyway.. they are just not as robust as a desktop.. or a good thinkpad for that matter
sorry I could not be more help
